page.title: 14 Barnwell's Womens Institute
page.content: Barnwell WI has come a long way in a short time,although basically it still has its roots of"Hearth and Home". Now it has been rejuvenated into an era of computers,silicon chips and microwave ovens. Its image of jam and Jerusalem is a thing of the past,and Barnwell a small link in the chain which started in a house in Stoney Creek, Ontario, Canada in 1897. It has a good working membership of 35 with a good number of young people coming up to fill places in the years ahead. It meets once a month in the Reading Room and affords many instructive and educational speakers. It regularly takes part in competitive classes at the East of England Show and the Oundle Music Festival. Members talents are many and varied which go to make a thriving womens' rural community organisation.
